intro: Chrysosplenium fallax, commonly known as the variable chrysosplenium, is a member of the Saxifragaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often with five petals. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a hairy texture. Native to moist, shaded habitats in temperate regions, it thrives in woodland and rocky areas.
